questions.question: Which HTML tag is used to create a hyperlink?
What attribute is used to specify the URL of the page the link goes to?
How do you create a link that opens in a new tab/window?
Which HTML tag is used to insert an image?
What attribute specifies the path to the image file?
Which attribute is used to provide alternative text for an image?
How do you create an email link?
What is the correct HTML for creating a bookmark within a page?
How do you link to a specific part of the same page?
choices: Use a '#' followed by the id of the element
Use a '/' followed by the element name
Use a '?' followed by the element id
Use a '@' followed by the element name
questions.answer: Use a '#' followed by the id of the element

questions.question: Which attribute is used to specify the width of an image?
How can you make an image into a link?
choices: Wrap the tag with an tag
Add a link attribute to the tag
Add a hyperlink property to the image file
questions.answer: Wrap the tag with an tag

questions.question: What does the 'title' attribute do when used with a link?
choices: Provides additional information about the link
Sets the title of the linked page
Defines the text of the link
Specifies the file type of the linked document
questions.answer: Provides additional information about the link

questions.question: Which attribute is used to specify the height of an image?
How do you create a link to download a file?
choices: Add the 'download' attribute to the <a> tag
Use a special URL prefix like 'download://'
questions.answer: Add the 'download' attribute to the <a> tag

questions.question: What is the purpose of the 'rel' attribute in a link?
choices: Specifies the relationship between the current document and the linked document
Defines the reliability of the link
Sets the reload time for the linked page
Specifies the release date of the linked content
questions.answer: Specifies the relationship between the current document and the linked document

questions.question: Which HTML5 element is used to specify multiple source files for image elements?
How do you create a link that dials a phone number?
What attribute is used to specify a different image to be shown when the mouse hovers over the original image?
Which HTML5 attribute is used to specify that a link should be followed without giving credit to the page containing the link?
What is the purpose of the 'loading' attribute in the tag?
choices: To specify how the browser should load the image
To set the loading speed of the image
questions.answer: To specify how the browser should load the image

questions.question: How do you create a link to send an SMS?
What is the purpose of the 'srcset' attribute in the tag?
choices: To specify multiple image sources for different screen sizes/resolutions
To define a set of source code files
To link multiple external style sheets
questions.answer: To specify multiple image sources for different screen sizes/resolutions

questions.question: Which attribute is used to specify the relationship between the current document and the linked document in a reverse direction?
What does the 'ismap' attribute do when used with an image inside a link?
choices: Specifies that the image is a server-side image map
Allows the image to be resized
questions.answer: Specifies that the image is a server-side image map

questions.question: How can you create a link that opens the user's default email client to compose a new email?
What is the purpose of the 'sizes' attribute in the tag when used with 'srcset'?
choices: To specify the size of each image in the srcset
To set the dimensions of the image
To limit the maximum size of the image
To define the font sizes for image captions
questions.answer: To specify the size of each image in the srcset

questions.question: Which attribute can be used to specify the MIME type of the linked document?
How do you create a link that opens in the parent frame?
What attribute is used to provide a text description of an image that appears when the image is hovered over?
Which HTML5 element is used to embed an image in a scalable vector graphic?
